blocks.title: Testing the MySQL data source connection

blocks.content:
The private data source connect (PDC) feature allows you to establish a secure connection between Grafana Cloud and your MySQL database.

If you don't use PDC, your queries and data are transmitted over the public internet, exposing them to potential security risks.
**Recommendation:** We recommend that you create a private connection whenever you connect Grafana Cloud to an external data source.

In the **Private data source connect** field, select the name of a PDC agent.

**Note:** For the test connection to be successful, you must select a PDC agent that's running.

Click **Save & test**.

When successful, you'll see the message: `Database Connection OK`
In the next milestone, you'll verify that MySQL data appears correctly in Grafana Cloud.

**Troubleshooting**

Explore the following troubleshooting topics if you need help:

- [My data source connection fails when using the Grafana MySQL data source plugin](/docs/grafana/latest/datasources/mysql/troubleshoot/#my-data-source-connection-fails-when-using-the-grafana-mysql-data-source-plugin)
- [What should I do if I see "An unexpected error happened" or "Could not connect to MySQL" after trying all of the above?](docs/grafana/latest/datasources/mysql/troubleshoot/#what-should-i-do-if-i-see-an-unexpected-error-happened-or-could-not-connect-to-mysql-after-trying-all-of-the-above)
